intro: Stellaria dichasioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf starwort, is a low-growing annual herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features small, star-shaped white flowers that typically bloom in early summer. The plant has slender, branching stems and narrow, lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, sunny environments such as rocky soils and open fields. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive member of the Caryophyllaceae family.
